text:
*[Bug 18948] Grammatical error in `summary`: should be "NA" not "NA's"*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18948>

--- Comment #10 from Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) ---
(In reply to Ayush Singh from comment #9)
That patch is broken: see, for example, how it changed

```
- NA's   :3           
+ NAs    :1970-01-04  
```

in the "reg-tests-2" reference output. (No need to submit a revised patch, I
had one on hold for a while.)

Note that using "NA" for logicals was an earlier suggestion but there was no
consensus about that: comment 8 in particular argued for a consistent use of
"NAs". I agree that replacing the current "NA's" with "NAs" in *all* cases
clearly simplifies adjustments in code building on "summaryDefault" output.

text:
*[Bug 18948] Grammatical error in `summary`: should be "NA" not "NA's"*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18948>

Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|CONFIRMED                   |CLOSED

--- Comment #11 from Sebastian Meyer (<mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>) ---
So I have now committed the consistent "NA's" -> "NAs" change in r89306 in the
trunk (to be R 4.6.0). This will affect reference outputs (.Rout.save) of
several packages, usually causing a check NOTE, but some packages will also
need to update their tests (which are easier to conditionalize on the R
version). Note that resolving Bug 16750 will again affect summary() outputs for
character vectors, so this is planned to happen soon.
